sub_topic: Logistic growth models for population growth
message_1: A population of rabbits was introduced to an island in 2010. The initial population was 500 rabbits and the carrying capacity of the island is estimated to be 2000 rabbits. The annual growth rate is 10%. Use a logistic growth model to determine the population of rabbits in 2022.
message_2:
To determine the population of rabbits in 2022 using a logistic growth model, we can use the following formula:

P(t) = K / (1 + (K - P0) / P0 * e^(-r * t))

Where:
P(t) = population at time t
K = carrying capacity (2000 rabbits)
P0 = initial population (500 rabbits)
r = annual growth rate (0.1 or 10%)
t = time in years (2022 - 2010 = 12 years)
e = base of the natural logarithm (approximately 2.718)

Plugging in the values:

P(12) = 2000 / (1 + (2000 - 500) / 500 * e^(-0.1 * 12))

P(12) = 2000 / (1 + 1500 / 500 * e^(-1.2))

P(12) = 2000 / (1 + 3 * e^(-1.2))

Now, we can calculate e^(-1.2) ≈ 0.301

P(12) = 2000 / (1 + 3 * 0.301)

P(12) = 2000 / (1 + 0.903)

P(12) = 2000 / 1.903

Finally, we get the population of rabbits in 2022:

P(12) ≈ 1051 rabbits

So, the population of rabbits in 2022 is estimated to be approximately 1051 rabbits.
